fullText:
FacebookTwitterLinkedInCopy Link

 

 
 
 
 
 
 

 
 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 

 
 
 Hamish Linklater and Lily Rabe in The Public Theater's Free Shakespeare in the Park production of ‘Cymbeline.’
 
 
 Photo: 
 
 Carol Rosegg
 
 
 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 

 
 
 
 By
 
 
 Pia Catton
 Close
 Pia Catton
 
 
 
 
 Biography
 
 
 
 
 
 @piacatton
 
 
 
 
 
 Pia.Catton@wsj.com
 
 
 
 

 

 

 
 July 28, 2015 9:17 pm ET
 

 

 
 
 
 
 
 Shakespeare’s plays are dotted with surprises, but only “Cymbeline” concludes with enough high jinks to feel like a sophisticated version of “Scooby-Doo.” In the last scene, there are so many revelations that the play baffles experts, who say they have counted anywhere from 17 to 30 news flashes onstage.

“If you blink, you miss a couple,” said Columbia University professor James Shapiro, who himself has counted at least 20 discoveries in the final scene, most of which are known to the audience but not to all of the characters.
